Caching & Performance Systems - Cheat Sheet

One-Page Quick Reference for Interviews

ğŸ¯ QUICK DECISION FRAMEWORK

When to Use Caching 

Performance Issues? â†’ Consider Caching
â”œâ”€ High Latency? â†’ Add Caching Layer
â”œâ”€ Low Throughput? â†’ Optimize Cache Strategy
â”œâ”€ High Memory Usage? â†’ Implement Cache Eviction
â””â”€ Network Bottlenecks? â†’ Use CDN Caching

Cache Type Selection 

Data Access Pattern?
â”œâ”€ Frequently Read, Rarely Written â†’ Application Cache
â”œâ”€ Global Distribution Needed â†’ CDN Cache
â”œâ”€ High Availability Required â†’ Distributed Cache
â”œâ”€ Hardware Optimization â†’ CPU/Memory Cache
â””â”€ Storage Performance â†’ Storage Cache

Cache Strategy Selection 

Data Characteristics?
â”œâ”€ Static Data â†’ Long TTL, Aggressive Caching
â”œâ”€ Dynamic Data â†’ Short TTL, Smart Invalidation
â”œâ”€ User-Specific â†’ Session-Based Caching
â”œâ”€ Computationally Expensive â†’ Result Caching
â””â”€ Frequently Updated â†’ Write-Through Caching

Cache Hierarchy

| Layer | Size | Latency | Use Case | |â€”â€”-|â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”-| | L1 Cache | 32-64KB | 1-3 cycles | CPU instructions/data | | L2 Cache | 256KB-1MB | 10-20 cycles | Unified cache | | L3 Cache | 8-32MB | 40-80 cycles | Shared across cores | | Memory Cache | 1-100GB | 100-1000ns | Application data | | Distributed Cache | 1TB+ | 1-10ms | Multi-node systems | | CDN Cache | Unlimited | 10-100ms | Global content |

Cache Performance Comparison

| Cache Type | Read Latency | Write Latency | Throughput | Memory Usage | |â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“| | CPU Cache | 1-40ns | 1-40ns | 100M+ ops/sec | 32KB-32MB | | Memory Cache | 100-1000ns | 100-1000ns | 1M+ ops/sec | 1-100GB | | Redis | 1-10ms | 1-10ms | 100K+ ops/sec | 1-1TB | | Distributed Cache | 1-50ms | 1-50ms | 10K+ ops/sec | 1TB+ | | CDN Cache | 10-100ms | N/A | 1K+ ops/sec | Unlimited |

ğŸ¯ CACHING STRATEGIES

Cache Placement Patterns

| Pattern | Consistency | Performance | Complexity | Use Case | |â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”-| | Cache-Aside | Eventual | High | Low | Simple applications | | Write-Through | Strong | Medium | Low | Critical data | | Write-Behind | Eventual | Very High | High | High-throughput systems | | Refresh-Ahead | Eventual | High | Medium | Predictive caching |

| Strategy | Implementation | Performance | Use Case | |â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”-| | TTL | Automatic expiration | High | Time-sensitive data | | Event-Based | Publish-subscribe | Medium | Real-time updates | | Version-Based | Cache key versioning | High | Schema changes | | Manual | Explicit invalidation | Low | Critical updates |

Latency Optimization Techniques

| Technique | Performance Gain | Implementation | Use Case | |â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”-| | Cache Warming | 20-50% | Pre-load data | Cold starts | | Stale-While-Revalidate | 50-80% | Return stale + update | High availability | | Cache Prefetching | 10-30% | Predict requests | Sequential access | | Connection Pooling | 30-60% | Reuse connections | Database caching |

Throughput Optimization

| Technique | Throughput Gain | Implementation | Use Case | |â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”-| | Batch Operations | 2-5x | Group operations | Bulk processing | | Pipeline Operations | 3-10x | Parallel processing | High concurrency | | Lock-Free Caching | 2-4x | Concurrent structures | Multi-threaded | | Compression | 20-50% | Reduce data size | Network caching |

| Technique | Memory Savings | Implementation | Use Case | |â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”-| | Memory Pooling | 30-60% | Reuse objects | Object creation | | Compression | 40-80% | Compress data | Large objects | | Eviction Policies | Variable | LRU, LFU, TTL | Memory constraints | | Cache Partitioning | Better utilization | Distribute load | Large datasets |

Cache Eviction Policies

| Policy | Algorithm | Performance | Best For | |â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”-| | LRU | Least Recently Used | O(1) | Temporal locality | | LFU | Least Frequently Used | O(log n) | Access patterns | | TTL | Time-To-Live | O(1) | Time-sensitive data | | FIFO | First-In-First-Out | O(1) | Simple scenarios |

ğŸ“Š PERFORMANCE METRICS

Key Performance Indicators

| Metric | Target | Monitoring | Action | |â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€“| | Cache Hit Ratio | >80% | Real-time | Optimize if <70% | | Average Latency | <10ms | P95, P99 | Investigate if >50ms | | Throughput | >10K ops/sec | Per second | Scale if <5K ops/sec | | Memory Usage | <80% capacity | Continuous | Evict if >90% | | Error Rate | <1% | Per minute | Alert if >5% |

Cache Hit Ratio Impact

| Hit Ratio | Performance | User Experience | Action | |â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€“| | 90%+ | Excellent | Great | Monitor | | 80-90% | Good | Good | Optimize | | 70-80% | Acceptable | Fair | Improve | | <70% | Poor | Bad | Major optimization |

âš ï¸ COMMON PITFALLS

Cache Stampede

  • Problem: Multiple requests for same missing data
  • Impact: Backend overload, poor performance
  • Solution: Cache warming, background refresh, request deduplication
  • Prevention: Implement cache warming strategies

Cache Pollution

  • Problem: Cache filled with rarely accessed data
  • Impact: Low hit ratio, memory waste
  • Solution: Appropriate TTL, effective eviction policies
  • Prevention: Monitor cache hit ratios and eviction rates

Cache Inconsistency

  • Problem: Cache data becomes stale
  • Impact: Incorrect data, user confusion
  • Solution: Proper invalidation strategies, consistency patterns
  • Prevention: Implement event-driven invalidation

ğŸ¯ INTERVIEW QUICK TIPS

When Asked About Caching:

  1. Start with Requirements: â€œWhat are the performance requirements?â€
  2. Analyze Access Patterns: â€œIs this read-heavy, write-heavy, or mixed?â€
  3. Consider Data Characteristics: â€œIs the data static, dynamic, or user-specific?â€
  4. Evaluate Trade-offs: â€œWhatâ€™s the consistency vs performance trade-off?â€
  5. Discuss Implementation: â€œWhat caching strategy would you use?â€

Quick Decision Framework for Interviews: 

Step 1: "What's the primary requirement?"
â”œâ”€ High Performance â†’ In-Memory Cache
â”œâ”€ Global Distribution â†’ CDN Cache
â”œâ”€ High Availability â†’ Distributed Cache
â”œâ”€ Hardware Optimization â†’ CPU/Memory Cache
â””â”€ Storage Performance â†’ Storage Cache

Step 2: "What are the trade-offs?"
â”œâ”€ Performance vs Consistency
â”œâ”€ Memory vs Speed
â”œâ”€ Complexity vs Functionality
â””â”€ Cost vs Benefits

Step 3: "What's the implementation approach?"
â”œâ”€ Cache placement strategy
â”œâ”€ Invalidation mechanism
â”œâ”€ Eviction policy
â””â”€ Monitoring and alerting

Common Interview Scenarios & Quick Answers:

â€œDesign a High-Performance Web Applicationâ€

  • Cache Strategy: Multi-layer caching (CDN + Application + Database)
  • Reasoning: Global performance, reduced backend load
  • Trade-offs: Cache consistency vs performance

â€œDesign a Social Media Feedâ€

  • Cache Strategy: User-specific caching + CDN for media
  • Reasoning: Personalized content, global media distribution
  • Trade-offs: Cache invalidation complexity vs performance

â€œDesign an E-commerce Platformâ€

  • Cache Strategy: Product catalog caching + session caching
  • Reasoning: Static product data, user session management
  • Trade-offs: Cache warming vs cold start performance

â€œDesign a Real-time Analytics Dashboardâ€

  • Cache Strategy: Result caching + time-series optimization
  • Reasoning: Expensive computations, time-based data
  • Trade-offs: Data freshness vs performance

Red Flags to Avoid in Interviews:

  • âŒ â€œIâ€™ll cache everythingâ€ - No consideration of cache invalidation
  • âŒ â€œCache hit ratio doesnâ€™t matterâ€ - Ignoring performance metrics
  • âŒ â€œWe donâ€™t need cache consistencyâ€ - Not considering data integrity
  • âŒ â€œMemory is unlimitedâ€ - Ignoring resource constraints
  • âŒ â€œCache warming is too complexâ€ - Not considering cold starts

Green Flags for Interviews:

  • âœ… â€œLet me understand the access patterns firstâ€ - Systematic approach
  • âœ… â€œWhatâ€™s the cache hit ratio target?â€ - Performance awareness
  • âœ… â€œHow do we handle cache invalidation?â€ - Consistency consideration
  • âœ… â€œWhatâ€™s the memory budget?â€ - Resource awareness
  • âœ… â€œHow do we monitor cache performance?â€ - Operational thinking

ğŸ“‹ QUICK REFERENCE: COMMON SCENARIOS

Cache Selection by Use Case

| Use Case | Primary Cache | Secondary Cache | Key Decision Factors | |â€”â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”| | Web Application | Application Cache | CDN Cache | Performance + global distribution | | Mobile App | Local Cache | Remote Cache | Offline capability + sync | | API Service | Response Cache | Database Cache | Latency + throughput | | Real-time System | In-Memory Cache | Distributed Cache | Speed + consistency | | Analytics Platform | Result Cache | Query Cache | Computation cost + data size | | E-commerce | Product Cache | Session Cache | Static data + user state | | Social Media | Feed Cache | Media Cache | Personalization + content | | Gaming | Game State Cache | Asset Cache | Real-time + resource loading |

Cache Selection by Data Pattern

| Data Pattern | Cache Choice | Reasoning | Trade-offs | |â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€“|â€”â€”â€”â€”| | Static Data | Long TTL Cache | Rarely changes | Stale data risk | | Dynamic Data | Short TTL Cache | Frequently changes | Cache miss penalty | | User-Specific | Session Cache | User context | Memory usage | | Computationally Expensive | Result Cache | High computation cost | Storage cost | | Frequently Accessed | Hot Data Cache | Access patterns | Memory allocation | | Large Objects | Compressed Cache | Storage efficiency | CPU overhead |

ğŸš€ SCALING PATTERNS

Horizontal Scaling

  • Distributed Caching: Multiple cache nodes
  • Consistent Hashing: Even distribution
  • Cache Replication: High availability
  • Load Balancing: Even load distribution

Vertical Scaling

  • Memory Expansion: Larger cache capacity
  • CPU Optimization: Better cache performance
  • Storage Optimization: Faster cache storage
  • Network Optimization: Reduced cache latency

âš–ï¸ CONSISTENCY MODELS

Strong Consistency

  • Write-Through: Immediate consistency
  • Synchronous Replication: All nodes updated
  • Use: Critical data, financial transactions
  • Trade-off: Higher latency

Eventual Consistency

  • Write-Behind: Background updates
  • Asynchronous Replication: Eventual sync
  • Use: Non-critical data, user preferences
  • Trade-off: Temporary inconsistency

ğŸ“ˆ PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION

Read-Heavy Workloads

  • Cache warming, aggressive caching, read replicas
  • Performance: 80%+ hit ratio, <10ms latency

Write-Heavy Workloads

  • Write-through caching, batch operations, write buffering
  • Performance: 50-70% hit ratio, <50ms latency

Mixed Workloads

  • Multi-layer caching, smart invalidation, adaptive TTL
  • Performance: 70-90% hit ratio, <20ms latency

ğŸ”§ COMMON IMPLEMENTATIONS

In-Memory Caches

  • Redis: High-performance, feature-rich
  • Memcached: Simple, fast, distributed
  • Hazelcast: Java-based, distributed
  • Caffeine: Java in-memory cache

Distributed Caches

  • Redis Cluster: Scalable, high availability
  • Hazelcast IMDG: In-memory data grid
  • Apache Ignite: Distributed computing platform
  • Infinispan: Java-based, distributed

CDN Caches

  • CloudFront: AWS global CDN
  • Cloud CDN: Google Cloud CDN
  • Azure CDN: Microsoft CDN
  • Fastly: Real-time CDN

ğŸ“Š MONITORING & ALERTING

Key Metrics to Monitor

  • Cache Hit Ratio: Primary performance indicator
  • Latency: P50, P95, P99 percentiles
  • Throughput: Operations per second
  • Memory Usage: Capacity and utilization
  • Error Rate: Cache failures and timeouts

Alerting Thresholds

  • Cache Hit Ratio < 70%: Performance degradation
  • Latency > 50ms: Slow response times
  • Memory Usage > 90%: Capacity issues
  • Error Rate > 5%: Cache failures

ğŸ¯ 50 CACHING INTERVIEW QUESTIONS

Basic Concepts

  1. What is caching and why use it?
  2. Explain cache hit vs cache miss
  3. What is cache hit ratio and why is it important?
  4. Describe different cache layers
  5. What is cache invalidation?

Cache Strategies

  1. Explain cache-aside pattern
  2. What is write-through caching?
  3. Describe write-behind caching
  4. What is cache warming?
  5. Explain stale-while-revalidate pattern

Cache Implementation

  1. How would you implement an LRU cache?
  2. What is consistent hashing?
  3. How do you handle cache eviction?
  4. Explain cache partitioning
  5. What is cache replication?

Performance Optimization

  1. How do you optimize cache performance?
  2. What is cache compression?
  3. Explain cache prefetching
  4. How do you handle cache stampede?
  5. What is cache pollution?

Distributed Caching

  1. How do you scale a cache horizontally?
  2. What is cache consistency?
  3. Explain cache coherency protocols
  4. How do you handle cache failures?
  5. What is cache partitioning?

Real-World Scenarios

  1. Design a caching strategy for a web application
  2. How would you cache a social media feed?
  3. Design caching for an e-commerce platform
  4. How do you cache API responses?
  5. Design caching for a real-time system

Advanced Concepts

  1. What is cache-oblivious algorithms?
  2. Explain cache-friendly data structures
  3. How do you optimize for CPU cache?
  4. What is cache line optimization?
  5. Explain memory hierarchy optimization

Monitoring & Observability

  1. What metrics do you monitor for caching?
  2. How do you debug cache issues?
  3. What is cache profiling?
  4. How do you measure cache effectiveness?
  5. What alerts do you set up for caching?

System Design Questions

  1. Design a distributed cache system
  2. How would you design a CDN?
  3. Design a caching layer for a database
  4. How do you cache in a microservices architecture?
  5. Design caching for a mobile application

Troubleshooting

  1. How do you handle cache failures?
  2. What do you do when cache hit ratio is low?
  3. How do you handle cache inconsistency?
  4. What happens when cache memory is full?
  5. How do you optimize cache for high concurrency?

â“ FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQs)

Common Misconceptions & Quick Answers

Q1: â€œCaching always improves performanceâ€

A: FALSE - Caching can hurt performance if:

  • Cache hit ratio is low (<50%)
  • Cache overhead exceeds benefits
  • Cache invalidation is too frequent
  • Memory pressure causes thrashing

Q2: â€œMore cache is always betterâ€

A: FALSE - More cache can be worse if:

  • Memory pressure affects other components
  • Cache warming time is too long
  • Cache complexity increases latency
  • Cost exceeds performance benefits

Q3: â€œCache consistency doesnâ€™t matter for performanceâ€

A: FALSE - Cache consistency affects:

  • User experience (stale data)
  • System reliability (incorrect data)
  • Debugging complexity
  • Business logic correctness

Q4: â€œCache hit ratio is the only metric that mattersâ€

A: FALSE - Other important metrics:

  • Latency (P95, P99)
  • Throughput (ops/sec)
  • Memory usage
  • Error rates
  • Cost per operation

Q5: â€œAll caching strategies are the sameâ€

A: FALSE - Different strategies for different needs:

  • Cache-aside: Simple, flexible
  • Write-through: Strong consistency
  • Write-behind: High performance
  • Refresh-ahead: No cache misses

Use this cheatsheet for quick reference during interviews. Remember: choose caching strategy based on requirements, not just familiarity.
